question: Can I afford a mortgage with a monthly payment of $1,200 given my annual income of $75,000 and no outstanding debts?
true_answer: Yes, with a monthly payment of $1,200, it is affordable given your income and no debts.

steps.content: Can I afford a mortgage with a monthly payment of $1,200 given my annual income of $75,000 and no outstanding debts?
Plan: 1) Calculate monthly income. 2) Call home_loan_agent for affordability rules. 3) Use calculator to check affordability. 4) Supervisor verification. 5) Provide final answer.
Retrieving knowledge on mortgage affordability criteria.
Affordability typically requires monthly payment to be below 28% of gross monthly income.
Calculating monthly income from annual income.
Calculating if $1,200 is below 28% of monthly income.
$1,200 is 19.2% of monthly income, which is affordable.
Are there any other costs I should be aware of?
Retrieving information on additional costs related to mortgage.
Additional costs may include property taxes, insurance, and maintenance.
Yes, with a monthly payment of $1,200, it is affordable given your income and no debts.
Also consider additional costs such as taxes, insurance, and maintenance.
